## Basics

- iff ‚Äì ‚Äúif and only if‚Äù
- $\relsize{A}$ ‚Äì Number of elements of $A$
- $\identity{A}$ ‚Äì Identity relation on $A$
- $\powerset{A}$ ‚Äì Power set of $A$
- $A^*$, $A^{\infty}$ ‚Äì Language of finite / finite-or-infinite words over $A$
- $\inverse{\rel R}$ ‚Äì Inverse relation of $\rel R$
- $\nats$, $\natsext$ ‚Äì Natural numbers / natural numbers extended by a $\infty$ as $\top$-element
- $\defeq$ ‚Äì Definitional equality; in the context of CCS $\literal{X} \defeq P$ also means $\ccsasg(\literal{X}) \defeq P$

## Orders and Vectors

- $\leq$ ‚Äì less-or-equal-to, usually point-wise on vectors
- $\Min(A)$, $\Max(A)$ ‚Äì Set of minimal / maximal elements in $A$ in the context of a preorder $\leq$
- $\lub$ / $\sup$, $\glb$ / $\inf$ ‚Äì Least uper bound / greatest lower bound in the context of a lattice (@def-lattice)
- $\upset A$, $\downset A$ ‚Äì Upward-closure / downward-closure of set $A$ in the context of a preorder $\leq$
- $\unitvec{k}$ ‚Äì Unit vector; component $k$ is 1, all others 0 (in the context of some dimensionality $d$)
- $\zerovec$ ‚Äì Vector of zeros (in the context of some dimensionality $d$); not to be confused with $\ccsnull$ as terminated $\ccs$-process in @def-ccs

## Transition Systems

- $\step{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Transition relation (in context of a transition system, @def-ts), usually due to operational $\ccs$-semantics (@def-ccs-semantics)
- $\nostep{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Absence of an $\alpha$-transition
- $\stepweak{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Internal transition (@def-transition-systems-with-silent-steps)
- $\stepopt{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Optional transition (@def-transition-systems-with-silent-steps)
- $\stepweakword{\vec{w}}$ ‚Äì Weak $\vec{w}$-word step sequence (@def-transition-systems-with-silent-steps)
- $\derivatives{p, \alpha}$ ‚Äì $\alpha$-derivatives of $p$ (@def-ts)
- $\initials{p}$ ‚Äì Enabled actions of $p$ (@def-ts)
- $\hmlobs{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Modality of observing an $\alpha$-step (@def-hml)
- $\hmlopt{\alpha}$ ‚Äì Modality of observing an $\tau$-optional $\alpha$-step ([@def-transition-systems-with-silent-steps] and [-@def-hml-srbb])
- $\hmleps$ ‚Äì Modality of allowing internal behavior ([@def-transition-systems-with-silent-steps] and [-@def-hml-srbb])
- $\semantics{\varphi}$ ‚Äì Set of states that fulfill $\varphi$ (@def-hml-semantics)
- $\quotient{\system}{\sim}$ ‚Äì Quotient system on equivalence classes $\eqclass{\cdot}_{\sim}$ (@def-quotient-ts)

## Behavioral Equivalences

- $\bpreordvar{N}$, $\beqvar{N}$ ‚Äì Behavioral preorder / equivalence with respect to notion $N$ (full names in @fig-strong-ltbt-spectrum and -@fig-weak-spectrum)
- $\beq{T}$, $\beq{S}$, $\beq{B}$ ‚Äì Strong trace equivalence, similarity, bisimilarity (@def-trace-eq, -@def-bisimilarity)
- $\bpreordvar{\observationsvar{}}$, $\beqvar{\observationsvar{}}$ ‚Äì Behavioral preorder / equivalence derived from a sublogic $\observationsvar{}\subseteq \hml$ (@def-distinctions)
- $\observationsvar{N}$ ‚Äì Observation logic for a notion $N \in \notions$ in the context of a spectrum (@def-spectrum)
- $\observations{\floor{B}}$ ‚Äì Bisimulation observation logic (@def-game-formulas)
- $\expr{}(\varphi)$ ‚Äì Syntactic expressiveness price of $\varphi$ in the context of a spectrum (@def-expressiveness-price)

## Games

- $\gamemoveblank$ ‚Äì Game move (@def-game)
- $\gamemove{u}$ ‚Äì Game move, labeled by an energy update (@def-energy-game)
- ${\game}_\notionname{B}$ ‚Äì Bisimulation game in the context of a transition system (@def-bisim-game)
- ${\game}_\notionname{B}^{üó≤}$ ‚Äì Bisimulation energy game (@def-bisim-energy-game)
- $\attackerwins$, $\defenderwins$ ‚Äì Attacker / defender winning regions in the context of a reachability game (@def-winning-region), or winning budgets in an energy game (@def-winning-budgets)
- $\attackerwinsmin(g)$ ‚Äì Minimal attacker winning budgets for position $g$ in an energy game (@def-winning-budgets)
- $\abstractupdate$, $\abstractupdateinv$ ‚Äì Updates on energy games (@def-energy-game) and their undo-function in the algorithm for Galois energy games (@alg-deciding-energy-games)
- $\energies$ ‚Äì Energy levels on declining energy games in the context of a dimensionality $d$ (@def-energy-updates)
- $\energyupdate$, $\energyupdateinv$ ‚Äì Updates on declining energy games (@def-energy-updates) and their undo-version (@def-declining-upd-inv)
- $\mathtt{min}_{A}$ ‚Äì A special kind of update component in declining energy games (@def-energy-updates)

## Spectroscopy

- $\notions_{p,q}$ ‚Äì Notions from $\notions$ in the context of a spectrum preordering states $p$ and $q$ (solution to @prob-spectroscopy-problem)
- $\gamespectroscopy$ ‚Äì Strong spectroscopy game, in the context of a transition system (@def-strong-spectroscopy-game)
- $\gamespectroscopyclever$ ‚Äì Clever spectroscopy game (@def-strong-spectroscopy-game-clever)
- $\gamespectroscopyeq{N}$, $\gamespectroscopyceq{N}$ ‚Äì  Equivalence game for $N$, derived from a spectroscopy game (@def-derived-eq-game)
- $\gamespectroscopyw$ ‚Äì Weak spectroscopy game, in the context of a transition system with silent steps (@def-weak-spectroscopy-game)
- $\gamespectroscopywsimple$ ‚Äì Simplified weak spectroscopy game (@fig-weak-spec-game-simplified)
- $\strat_\notionname{B}$, $\stratstrong$, $\stratweak$ ‚Äì Strategy formulas in the context of polynomial / strong / weak spectroscopy (@def-strategy-formulas-poly, -@def-strategy-formulas-strong, -@def-strategy-formulas-weak)

## Complexity

- $\bigo{f}$ ‚Äì Set of functions that grow to infinity at most as quickly as $f$
- $\complexityname{P}$, $\complexityname{NP}$, $\complexityname{PSPACE}$ ‚Äì Complexity classes of deterministic polynomial time / non-deterministic polynomial time / polynomial space complexity


## Recurring Examples

- $\literal{P}$, $\literal{Q}$ ‚Äî Two systems of philosophers, differing in their determinism (@exm-ts, -@exm-ccs, -@exm-deterministic-phil)
- $\literal{T}$ ‚Äì Trolled philosophers with additional $\troll$-deadlock (@exm-bisim-sim)
- $\literal{Pe}$, $\literal{Mx}$ ‚Äì Implementation of Peterson's mutual exclusion protocol and its specification (@exm-peterson-mutex), `Pe` and `Mx` for their expression in the tool (@sec-equivio-peterson)
